intro: Euclinia suavissima, commonly known as the sweet-scented euclinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Euclinia suavissima is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
